body_html:
Thanks for your comment @perfinion .

You're right, libtensorflow_cc.so is quite large.

the C++ API/ABI was not stable yet
Do you know if that's also true for just running inference?

Although it'd require more work, with the appropriate guidance I might be able to look into a cleaner solution. Maybe an additional artifact (e.g. deb packge in Debian/Ubuntu) that gets generated for the C++ interface only, and also installing it in the standard path.
Do you know how to roughly do that, and where? (some additional bazel rules, ...)

body:
Thanks for your comment @perfinion .

You're right, `libtensorflow_cc.so` is quite large.

> the C++ API/ABI was not stable yet
Do you know if that's also true for just running inference?

Although it'd require more work, with the appropriate guidance I might be able to look into a cleaner solution. Maybe an additional artifact (e.g. deb packge in Debian/Ubuntu) that gets generated for the C++ interface only, and also installing it in the standard path.
Do you know how to roughly do that, and where? (some additional bazel rules, ...)
